Reviews.Title: Excellent value-packed easy-to-use camera that is great for a novice first-timer.
Reviews.Author: ůźŸ ωŬ

Reviews.Title: Nice, basic camera
Reviews.Author: C. Wells
Reviews.Content: This camera arrived just in time for me...my digital point and shoot from another manufacturer bit the dust while on a family vacation, but fortunately, I had thrown this one in my suitcase at the last minute.  It is REALLY easy to use...I was pretty much off and running as soon as I got the battery charged up...no need to figure out how to work it.  Having used another digital point and shoot, it was intuitive.  It is a durable and classy looking little thing and with its smooth edges, it fits nicely in a pocket.  The only thing I don't like about it is there is no obvious "hand hold" area.  Although I haven't dropped it, I am certain to keep the strap around my wrist as it feels like I could easily drop it while taking a picture.I'm quite happy with the quality of the images, both with and without the flash...keeping in mind that any small camera like this will have limited flash capabilities.  This is a really nice basic camera, especially at the current Amazon price.  I've put a wraparound cover on mine to protect it and I keep it in my purse or in the car all the time to catch those spur-of-the moment shots.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value-packed easy-to-use camera that is great for a novice first-timer.
Reviews.Author: ůźŸ ωŬ

Reviews.Title: Lasted less than a year
Reviews.Author: Robin
Reviews.Content: It got something on the sensor in the lens and progressively got worse.  I thought the lens was dirty.  I didn't realize it was a manufacturing defect until the warranty was up.  Panasonic chose to not stand behind the product because I didn't contact them in time.  Of course I have pictures that can establish the date of the defect because it is visible on pictures I took.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Mom of three
Reviews.Content: I had the more expensive Lumix and replaced it with a Coolpix after I accidentally sent it through the laundry...so happy the Coolpix died so I could get this! It is perfectly what I need- no complicated settings, takes great video and still pic's, shortest delay on any camera I have seen, small, great battery life...I have NO "CONS"! Be sure to check the price on different colors of the same exact camera- the red one was $20 cheaper than any other when I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazonian
Reviews.Content: Solid camera with nice functions for the price. Takes great pictures and videos and is easy to use. No crazy editing features like on high end cameras but the functionality of the unit is very nice and will perfectly satisfy 90% of normal users.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Annie Coomes
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter who is the facebook queen and she loves the capabilities, Pictures are very clear.  Video capabilities were great.  The camera took long videos and didnot have any trouble with over 5 minutes.  Great camera for the price and functionality

Reviews.Title: Great beginning Camera
Reviews.Author: ebbgr
Reviews.Content: We have already used this camera for Thanksgiving and Christmas parties.  It takes fantastic close-up pictures of faces due to its specialized skin-tone setting.  We have already used it for my son's college graduation pictures.  It is very easy to download the pics to the computer and eventually automatically sending the pics to the local pharmacy store for printouts.The only disadvantage: The macro capabilities (taking close-up pictures of plants or collectibles) may not be perfect, but it could be that I haven't figured that aspect yet. Four and a half stars out of five is what I would rate this great camera for the price (about 79 bucks).

Reviews.Title: Very Happy So Far
Reviews.Author: Frank "Squidder"
Reviews.Content: I have already had a slr type digital camera which limited the places I would take the camera. I got Lumix for it's compact size, and based on the Amazon reviews it was the best bang for the buck with the features I needed. I plan to use it outdoors so I purchased the drops and spills coverage, $22 for three years can't be beat. Also purchased the recomended case and 8gb card. Very happy with the pictures and ease of transfering the pictures by usb or card. I forget I have have it on my belt it so light. For the average person it's agreat buy, alrerady recommened it to a friend and she purchased one as well.

Reviews.Title: Great results for a $100 camera
Reviews.Author: Gil
Reviews.Content: It's a ~$100 camera so you need to set your expectation level. I bought this for my daughter for her 7th birthday and she loves it. I managed to explore the camera a little bit. Basically, you do get a lot for the money:* Very compact* Pretty good battery life* easy to use* reasonably fast* most important: good quality pics in most 'common' conditions* many preset scene modes* nice face detection capabilities* light and stylish. My daughter's is purple.things I did not like so much:* 'intelligent auto' mode sometimes is not that intelligent... many times just using 'auto' mode or selecting the right scene mode is better. It is tempting to use 'iA' though because it really does all the settings for you - a true point and shoot. However using 'auto' will get you there in most situations.* no manual controls at all* 'sunset' scene mode did not produce good sunset pictures. However, the 'iA' mode did a lot better.* macro capabilities are pretty good but I would expect better from a compact camera. This camera does not have a 'close up' or similar scene that I've noticed.Overall - if you need a camera for that budget, i recommend. I have a Nikon L22 and I personally prefer the Panasonic. It's more compact, easy to use and has better battery life.

Reviews.Title: I immediately started using it.  It's easy!
Reviews.Author: L. Staley
Reviews.Content: We bought a Fujifilm FinePix S1500 a couple of years ago.  It is a great camera, but kind of big and clunky.  We wanted a smaller camera we could just stick in a pocket for those times we just wanted to snap some casual pictures and/or we didn't want to lug the larger camera with us.  This camera is great for that.I took it out of the box, charged the battery, and put it together to take with me.  The pictures it took were good quality; I was surprised how good they were. There was no blurriness and, as another review mentions, there seemed to be no lag between when I pressed the button and when the pictures were taken.  The buttons were intuitive and I was able to move through the different functions easily.  I loaded the software that came in the box onto my computer.  Then, I easily transferred the pictures to my computer.Overall, I am really pleased and look forward to using this camera in the future.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, affordable camera!
Reviews.Author: ChristianChick'sThoughts
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic S3 Lumix is a great little point-and-shoot camera! It is lightweight, easy to use, and takes great pictures. I took this camera on a vacation to San Diego, and nearly all of my pictures turned out great. I used the iA (intelligent auto) mode most of the time--when set on this mode, the camera automatically chooses the correct settings for your picture. There are also several scene settings to choose from if you don't want to use iA mode. The only time I really used a scene setting was at the beach; otherwise, the iA mode worked wonderfully. The optical image stabilizer is one of my favorite features. It automatically compensates for shaky hands and allowed me to get incredibly clear pictures. This camera is leaps and bounds better than my previous camera, a 9.0 megapixel Fujifilm FinePix, and it's pretty cheap, too!A word about the software (and this is what keeps me from giving the camera 5 stars): I installed the PHOTOfunSTUDIO editing software that comes with the camera and then promptly uninstalled it. The features are similar to those in Picasa, but it wasn't as easy to use, and the program ran very slowly on my machine, which has plenty of memory and runs Windows 7.  I wouldn't recommend using the editing software--stick with Picasa or even Microsoft Office Picture Manager!

Reviews.Title: Good starter camera
Reviews.Author: Tiffany A. Harkleroad "Tiffanys Bookshelf"
Reviews.Content: This week, I received a camera to review.  The camera is Panasonic Lumix.  The camera is nice and compact, and fits into the palm of your hand.I really liked the look and feel of the camera.  There is something to be said about a nice compact camera.  It is nice and light, a great camera to throw in your purse or bag.In terms of the camera itself, there are some really nice features.  The scene mode has more scene options than most of the cameras I have had in the past, including special settings for snow, fireworks, and food as well as the standard modes like portrait, scenery, and sports.  The menus and settings seem fairly easy to use.One thing important to note is that while there is a place to control the exposure, I do not think there is a way to control the shutter speed, ISP, or f stop, so this is a very basic camera.  This makes it a great starter camera, or a nice camera for young adults.There is 70 MB of built in memory, which is nice if you forget to load a memory card; you can still store a few pictures or some video in the internal memory.  I like this feature, because I have, in the past, forgotten to put my memory card back in the camera, and lost photo opportunities as a result.The quality of the photos is not bad for as 14.1 MP camera, but for someone used to a more powerful point and shoot, like I am, the images can seem a little fuzzy, even with the image stabilizer.  Close up photos are fairly good, but the zoomed pictures are not as clear as I would like.The same pretty much applies for the video quality.  Good for the level of camera, but not as good as I would prefer.One thing I am totally unimpressed with is the software that comes with the camera.  It did not install easily, and some components would not install at all, so I did not get to mess with the software much.  What I did see of it, however, did not impress me at all.  I will not use the software, and will instead continue storing photos on my external hard drive, and using other programs to edit and upload.So overall, a nice little camera for casual picture takers, beginners, or teenagers.  But the software leaves a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: Does not live up to its billing- worst camera I have owned
Reviews.Author: James E. Breneman "jimbreneman"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on the reviews. Mistake.. the reviews must have been done by internal Panasonic people. The iA mode produces "waves" on pictures, the stabilization does not work, setting scenery modes (e.g. indoor) and taking pictures sometimes works, sometimes the same picture is overexposed. The shame of it is this was a gift for one of my kids, he didn't tell me about how terrible it was until just last week when I asked him how it was working. He showed me, I checked it out as well, and I just ordered him a Canon Powershot. I am now dubious of not only ALL Panasonic cameras, but also AMAZON feedback.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value-packed easy-to-use camera that is great for a novice first-timer.
Reviews.Author: ůźŸ ωŬ

Reviews.Title: Lots of research to decide on this camera
Reviews.Author: Edsel
Reviews.Content: This camera is just what I wanted.  It has a feature where the screen is viewable while in bright sunlight.  The pictures are better than expected. The reason for 4 stars: manual is lousy and Panasonic customer help is chaotic.  Movie-making is too confusing, I can't get it to replay on screen, but I'm new to digitals and probably should blame myself.  I haven't dealt with the added Loilo software, so can't say if it's useful.If you figure out the movie-making, I would highly recommend buying this camera for the picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: acloy
Reviews.Content: Seems to be an excellent value. Purchased this for a gift for my sister and messed around with it when she opened it. Immediately impressed with clarity of images, ease of use, and overall value.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING
Reviews.Author: Gregory
Reviews.Content: this camera is light but I take a pictures very professional like if this camera was from a photographer , I RECOMMEND.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix 4X Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Billings
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera for a decent basic camera and it has proved to be just that.  Not too many functions to confuse me but enough to handle all the pictures I take and then some.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Granddaughter
Reviews.Author: Jazzmandan
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our 6 year old granddaughter and were delighted to see her eyes light up when she opened the box and proclaim her pleasure at receiving a "real gift" instead of a toy. I'm sure she would have loved it anyway, but the fact that it's purple was icing on the cake.I guess that by now we shouldn't be surprised, but while it took us a while to figure things out and get the camera ready to go for her, she somehow know exactly what to do from the first minutes.A great "big girl" gift at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, very happy
Reviews.Author: EdenBlessing
Reviews.Content: I am very much enjoying this camera, it does so much for what isn't that huge of a price.There's so many options to help you amateurs like me get good pictures.The display is great, you can see it outside no problem.The menu items/options are fairly easy to get to.It has no problems uploading to my computer without using the annoying software that came with it- my Win 7just auto recognizes it and imports the pictures, and then erase them off the camera all in one process too if you want.The only thing I find somewhat difficult is the odd focus thing, when you push the shutter halfway, it auto selects areas it thinks you want to focus on, if that's not where you want the focus you just let go and push halfway again until it selects the area you want. or you can have it autoselect a large grid instead.That's probably just me though, and I have been getting the best pictures I have ever taken.Comes with the cord to connect to the computer, and the battery & charger.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: chief
Reviews.Content: Right out of the box this camera worked super-pictures were always great and unit hooked to my pc quickly and battery charges fast.

Reviews.Title: Great camers
Reviews.Author: Trina Strong
Reviews.Content: This camera went with me to Ireland and took the most amazing pictures with it. For the price you can't go wrong for this small camera that fit easily in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: We were looking for the best inexpensive digital camera we could find.  This is it - it takes good shots, is easy to use, battery holds very long charge.  You do need to buy a memory card for it or you'll only get about 12 pictures before it's full.  Once we got the card, it's great and takes many, many pictures.  Works best in good light and outdoors.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Walter Monserratte "WALTERMON"
Reviews.Content: very fast arrival soon I give 5 stars'll buy other again, they are very professional, pleasant delivers recommend anyone requiring purchase many thanks

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: S. Schwalem
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a back-up to my Nikon D-SLR, but I find myself using it more than my Nikon.  It's a great size that fits in just about any pocket.  It's small enough to sneak it in to places that don't allow cameras, and it takes really great pictures.  I like to use the normal setting so that I can set the ISO that I want to use, and I've been able to get some very decent low light shots without the use of a flash.

Reviews.Title: Nice size, fairly easy to use, good quality pictures and video
Reviews.Author: B. Grandon
Reviews.Content: I got it for the price and convenience and the reviews here.It is a good little camera. I like the red because its easier to find in your purse or among your things if you're traveling.The picture quality is nice, pictures are easy to upload to your computer, the battery length is good if you dont play too many videos back.The biggest gripe with it is the non intuitive menu. No logical place where you move from looking at a picture or video to taking another. I found out how to do it by accident! Disclaimer, I am challenged by camera menus so they need to be really simple for me to feel they are easy to use!Probably many people would figure it out quickly.

Reviews.Title: "EASY HANDLING CAMERA"
Reviews.Author: Harold
Reviews.Content: I buy this camera for my sister,she loves it.Have the basic of a digital camera,easy handling,4 optical zoom,auto detection mode,its very lightweight,and the battery life is ok.The negative point of this camera is the base is made in plastic,if the manufacturers replacing this for steel we would have a solid camera,more durable.

Reviews.Title: Solid, inexpensive camera
Reviews.Author: FinancialGenie2020
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera right before I headed off to Asia.  It is a good, reliable camera with a good battery life.  This is exactly what I needed given that I am a novice and the photos were for personal use and to post to facebook.  If you're someone who needs complicated photography features, this is probably not your camera (you will probably have to spend much more $$ though).  All-in-all, this camera is sleek, easy-to-use and the quality is pretty good for the price.

Reviews.Title: Small, decent quality, good price
Reviews.Author: CentralCA
Reviews.Content: Received this as a gift.  Was looking for a small point and shoot that would be easier to fit in my purse than my Fuji FinePix S6000.  This camera is smaller than my phone, light, with decent quality photos.  Flash works fine, but shots outdoors look the best.  Bought a generic SD card which works with the camera, but not in my photo printer.  Overall, good for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, Good Price
Reviews.Author: Abhi
Reviews.Content: I've had the camera for about 2 weeks now and it has been working great. I am not a photographer and I use cameras mainly for pictures with friends, family, etc... So this camera, with its materialistic design was perfect. It takes pictures quickly and with pretty good resolution. The only thing it doesn't have is that feature where it lets you take multiple shots within a few seconds (continuous shutter, I believe its called). Anyway, it was few of the fancy features my previous cameras have had but since I never ended up using them, I don't miss them. Overall, great camera.

Reviews.Title: Does A Good Job For What It Is
Reviews.Author: Shopper Dave
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera easy, EASY to operate, and does what it says it'll do.  What's not to like?  I had to laugh at the reviewers who complained about graininess in low light level situations.  DUH!  This is photography, not magic. TURN THE FLASH ON! I just hope that I never drop it onto something hard.  I've had it for a couple of days, will review again in a year or so.

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: D.Allen
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for my mom to replace one my daughter lost. My mom is not very Tech. savvy, so we wanted to buy a camera that was very easy to use and understand for her. She Likes the camera and I haven't gotten the calls on how operate it so I like it too.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Robin Bailey
Reviews.Content: I bought two cameras like this for my kids.  I have the red one and also the purple one.  The camera may not "feel" like a great camera because it is very light and almost plastic-y.  However, this camera takes excellent pictures.  My kids decided to test how the camera as soon as they got it.  One kid was spinning, while the kid that held the cameras was jumping up and down.  The photos came out clear- every time.  I was not expecting such great photos, especially for the price.  I bought these cameras so my kids would leave my "expensive" one alone, but after seeing the great photos that this camera takes, as well as the lightweight capacity, I am sold.  I can not speak to all the features, as we have only tested out the basic point and shoot features, but I would definitely recommend this camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good budget camera
Reviews.Author: Sakith
Reviews.Content: Good camera for under $100.Picture quality is good.No much lag time between capturing photos.Handling is convenient.Photos will not come in low light. But get good pictures with flash.

Reviews.Title: Love this little guy!
Reviews.Author: yollaster
Reviews.Content: I bought this camere because my other camera was garbage. I have had nothing but bad luck with these digital cameras over the year. So I was looking for something that was basic and easy to use. This camera does the job and is easy to operate. I would buy this product again and I would recomend this to family and friends!

Reviews.Title: small, simple camera
Reviews.Author: Alan E. Schmidt "CD"
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted something small, simple and very easy to use camera. This Panasonic Lumix is the one. She loves it.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: A. Martin "music junkie"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera as a gift for my daughter. She needed a camera that is simple to use and takes great pictures. This one fits the bill perfectly. I've had several Panasonic cameras and have had very good luck with them. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a compact camera that takes good pictures and doesnt waste your time messing around with numerous settings.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the price
Reviews.Author: #1 Amazon Fan
Reviews.Content: The camera takes very good pictures and has one of the simplest menus I have seen out of a half dozen I have tried previously. I have never used a Panasonic camera before and was not sure what to expect; I guess I have been "brand loyal" to Canon and Sony for too long. I misplaced my compact Sony not long after getting this camera and discovered I liked it more due to the simpler menus and faster responses. I am a firm believer that once you get above 8-10 megapixels on a digital camera for home use, it is pretty much a non-factor in quality. Of course, the prices have come down so much and they keep churning out newer models with ever higher specs, so the price point is sufficient to not pay much  attention to the resolution. My family has also used the camera and found it very easy to use. Overall, a very nice and compact camera with a good battery life and quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: nice camera for beginner
Reviews.Author: M. Winter "helmet"
Reviews.Content: a nice camera for a young person who wants to begin taking pictures.recommended.  Gave to a 7 and 8 year old, but have only used a few days, but the kids loved them.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-S3
Reviews.Author: Lewis J. Powers
Reviews.Content: For a modest price, this is a good snapshot camera.  It's simple to operate, and small enough that I take it with me more often than larger cameras.  I like that it retains setting from one picture session to the next (I prefer the flash turned off as a default.)  After experimenting a bit with modes, I'm very happy with the resulting images.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: bailey
Reviews.Content: This camera takes good pictures. Didnt have to read the book, very easy to use.  I like it and would buy this again.

Reviews.Title: Super camera!
Reviews.Author: paw
Reviews.Content: This is a great little digital camera.  It is compact, light weight, easy to use, and produces excellent pictures.  This particular camera was a gift for a teenage girl, so the color was perfect.  It was so easy, straight from the box, she was taking photos and video without hesitation.  Glad I looked at reviews before purchasing, because this was not what I was initially looking to purchase.  If I personally had one complaint, it would be that it is so compact that the on/off button and photo buttons on top are a little difficult for my fingers, but that is a very small concern overall.

Reviews.Title: Great on the GO
Reviews.Author: R. Persaud "R. Persaud"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a month ago, and so far its working great!  I play with the different settings and am not dissapointed.  I deducted 1 star because I can't seem to get the "night landscape" right, I stick with "night portrait" for better results.  This camera takes great pics and video.... and fits into my clutch!!

Reviews.Title: Good one!  Just what I needed!
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: I needed to get a camera for my niece who is ten years old.  It had to be easy to use, good quality, not very expensive and of course purple!! This Panasonic Lumix was what I was looking for.  She adored it and the quality of the pictures are great!

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: B. guttman
Reviews.Content: This camera takes amazingly clear pictures!  Has quick shutter time, good battery life, and it's great that the battery is rechargable.  I got this camera for my 11 yr old who loves taking pictures, and I think her camera's better than my Sony-more expensive model!  Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice for a budget digital camera, has date stamp
Reviews.Author: Gadgester "No Time, No Money"
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo306KF5EC7VIFU', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo306KF5EC7VIFUloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } cv_mo306KF5EC7VIFUpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo306KF5EC7VIFUpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/91drtVfo3pS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo306KF5EC7VIFUpreplay.parentNode; var cv_mo306KF5EC7VIFUcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo306KF5EC7VIFUcurrentClick) { return cv_mo306KF5EC7VIFUcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:24 MinsMy short video clip was shot indoors at my desk at the VGA resolution.Unlike most other reviewers here, I paid for my own Panasonic DMC-S3 camera. I purchased my white S3 at Costco for under 100 dollars, and the Costco bundle came with a very nice case and a Transcend 2GB SD memory card. The S3's own box included a LiIon battery pack, a one-piece battery charger (no cord needed), a hand strap, a USB cable, and the software CD-ROM.The S3 weighs 4 oz. with battery and card and is what we used to call an idiot-proof camera. It has only 4 shooting modes: Panasonic's famous iA (intelligent auto) mode, which is simply the best automatic scene-dependent shooting mode on the compact digital camera market today, a normal mode that is similar to the program mode on other digital cameras, a scene mode that lets you pick from 16 presets (including high sensitivity, sports, portrait, baby, etc.), and a camcorder mode that shoots video in Quicktime format at 1280x720, 640x480 (VGA) or 320x240 (QVGA) resolutions. BTW, unlike more expensive Panasonic cameras, the S3 cannot zoom while shooting video, a pity.The S3 comes in several colors; mine is white and looks very stylish. It feels good and light in the hand, although I also think it feels almost like a toy, but not in a bad way. The plastic casing seems durable (and fingerprint-friendly), and the buttons are all solid and easy to press.Unlike other digicams in this price range or even more expensive, the S3 exhibits little shutter lag, that is, as soon as you press the shutter button, it takes the picture (unless it's really dark in the room). The S3 takes excellent outdoor pictures, with excellent color accuracy and contrast and good focus. Indoors, most of the no-flash pictures I have taken of my kids look good, but understandably the digital noise is higher. Indoor flash photography is not something I'd call good on any compact digital camera, including this one, although the flash does make a good fill-in flash outdoors when the subject's face has shadows.Overall, I find the S3 *very* pleasant to use. Its good performance in shutter lag and excellent outdoor picture quality and good indoor quality make it a winner for a low-cost, no-brainer take-it-anywhere camera.

Reviews.Title: Decent Camera for Pointing and Shooting Only
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: The last camera that I owned was a 35mm, and I was about 12 years old. I was in need of a camera for a trip to Los Angeles, where I would need to document some of the people, places, and things I would see while there. This camera seemed ideal to me because I didn't have a lot of time to learn how to use a camera, and I was under the impression that all that mattered was simply pointing and shooting.The camera arrived, and I immediately charged the battery so that I could start playing around with it and getting accustomed to it before I left for my trip. The battery charges in about 2 hour and I happily started snapping away, at first pleased with the pictures I was taking.We have an extra memory card that I have been using with my camera, and it is really simple to move the pictures from the memory card to iPhoto so that I can upload them on facebook or in an online photo album. One day on my trip, I actually forgot to put my memory card into my camera and was unaware that the pictures were going directly onto the camera's memory. After taking what seemed like no more than 10-15 pictures, I was informed that my memory was full and that I could not take anymore pictures. I really wish that the camera's memory could hold more pictures than it does.The cable that comes with the camera was also easy to use so that I could then move the pictures stored in the camera's memory into iPhoto. Everything about the operation of the camera is simplistic, and I think it would be a fine camera for someone who wants to do little more than upload pictures onto facebook or Twitter. It would also be a good learning camera for teenagers or young adults interested in photography to decide if this is a hobby worth pursuing.I really started to see the difference with the quality of the pictures this camera could take when I compared my photos to others that were taken with higher end cameras. My photos came out grainy and with really bright spots, whereas photos taken by my peers on this trip came out with perfect color balance and clarity.I don't have an interest in pursuing photography like my husband does, but overall this camera takes care of photos I might decide to snap during the daytime. I've been disappointed with its ability in capturing nighttime images, but will expand my knowledge of photography and how this camera operates and see if I can find a happy balance.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix
Reviews.Author: Ferdy
Reviews.Content: This camera is very light weight and easy to use.  It's full of featuresto accommodate most typical shooting conditions.  The panoramic assistneeds a little improvement.  It's still difficult to align for the nextshot.  The macro focus works well.  I've been able to take detailedpictures of flowers and insects.I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: The picture that I took...
Reviews.Author: Waltersog
Reviews.Content: I have bought many Digital Cameras in my life and I must tell you it's the best invesment I have ever made...Buy it!.

Reviews.Title: Good but room for improvement.
Reviews.Author: P. Jensen
Reviews.Content: My wife bought me this camera on Amazon for Christmas.  I started using it immediately and I am very impressed by the picture quality.  The camera feels good in the hand and the controls are well placed.  A few things hit me right away.  First, you must remove the battery from the camera and place it in a charger then plug it into the wall.  This is a little inconvenient as most cameras allow you to leave the battery in the camera while charging.  Second, There's only one 16 X 9 format that you can choose.  It's 10 MB which is fine but why would they make a camera with like a dozen 4 X 3 modes and only one 16 X 9.  Everyone wants to see their pics on a widescreen TV and not a 4 X 3.  This really surprised me.  Third, the camera has a cheap plastic feel to it.  The body is a shiny plastic black finish which feels not as strong.  Otherwise, the pics are good and it is very small and light.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera; great value
Reviews.Author: CJ-MO
Reviews.Content: This model of the Panasonic Lumix is a great camera for the type and price-range. Panasonic is a reliable brand, which I appreciate for electronic items. The online photo of the camera itself doesn't do it justice. It is has a glossy black color with silver trim that looks very nice. The camera is small, lightweight, and convenient to carry around. It's a good alternative to a cell phone camera when you want features such as a better zoom capability or a flash.One feature I really like is it comes with a rechargeable lithium ion battery and a well accessory for use in charging. A light will come on to let you know it's plugged in correctly and charging. It takes about two hours to fully charge.The camera comes with a small, 20 page owner's manual highlighting the basic features. Detailed instructions are included on a DVD. It's a simple point and shoot camera, so as soon as the battery charged, I was able to take pictures right away.Software is included to download and edit photos, but I was able to use the standard software included in Windows to handle my photos. If you take a photo and immediately decide you don't like it after viewing on the screen, you can hit the convenient "trash can" button on the front of the camera to delete it in one step. I also like how easy it is to switch from "playback" to "picture taking" mode.The quality of the photos are great for online use. Printed photos look good as well. There aren't a lot of special features, but for a highly portable camera that is easy to use, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Hilarious: Instruction leaflets not in English!
Reviews.Author: E. Dinar
Reviews.Content: The camera came. Upon opening the box, I saw that the instruction leaflets (Basic Instructions, leaflet VQT3E23-3 and Installation of Software, leaflet VQC8056) were in Spanish and Portuguese. There were no mention in Amazon’s site of these leaflets were to be Spanish and Portuguese; on the other hand, the leaflets could have been in Russian, Greek, Chinese, Korean so I would have absolutely no idea what they are referring to. I sent an email to the vendor to Express Mail me these leaflets in English. Presently I do not dare to touch the camera without instructions; once the English leaflets are delivered, I will be able to operate the camera and comment if there are any further issues.

Reviews.Title: Camera nice...Instructions not in English!
Reviews.Author: Lottie "Lottie"
Reviews.Content: One BIG criticism:  The directions w camera are in SPANISH.  I live in Mass...give me a break!  I printed 42 page online instructions but can't carry them w me! Seller KNOWs this!  Shame on them! Needed cheapie 4 my lost  Canon.  NO memory cd w camera.Plusses:  CS is primo!  NO prerecorded menus!  English speaking here in USA.Psonic Lum. is a TOP-RATED "point-shoot"  Rechrgr /USB cable inclded

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Melissa Schultz
Reviews.Content: I like the camera I just wish that you could charge the battery w/o taking it out of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Present
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Campbell "jesus was a heady bro"
Reviews.Content: I got this for my dad and he loves it! And it's red so he can't loose it! It takes decent pictures, not the best, but they're pretty good for an inexpensive camera

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: HighHeelLover
Reviews.Content: The color is a bit uglier in person. It is also not as intuitive as I would have liked it to be compared to other cameras I've owned. The battery has a special charger and can't be charged while in the camera. I've had better cameras and the shape of this one is a bit funny. It can feel bulky and it doesn't have a sturdy feel to it.

Reviews.Title: Great basic camera
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: Very nice point and shoot, I would say the best image quality with the least amount of effort. The menus and options are easy to navigate to avoid confusion. I fiddled around with the settings but found when left on auto and no flash (good lighting) I get excellent, accurate results. Camera has a plasticky feel but not in a bad way, nothing loose or rattling..  grip is a bit slick at times though. Flash is weak, 3-6 ft is OK. Comes with nice camera strap and battery charger. Overall I think its one of the best budget cameras, great for people who need something basic but accurate eg. people who sell stuff online. For more important stuff - vacations, memories etc. personally I would go for something a bit better. I heard great things about higher end Panasonic with Leica lens. I also prefer Panasonic's user interface over Canon. The DMC-S3 is a solid budget performer (again, under good lighting).

Reviews.Title: Canon A490 is better in JPEG quality
Reviews.Author: H. Ma
Reviews.Content: I basically compared JPEG quality of this camera with that of Canon A490 which I bought a few months ago.  Canon beats Panasonic in this aspect (5 stars vs. 4 stars). Photos taken in "Standard" color mode are not as sharp as those taken in "Vivid" mode.  At ISO-100 on sunny days, photos from Canon A490 are just as superb as those from my Canon T2i.  This Panasonic S3, however, is a little but noticeably behind in JPEG quality, but it is not very bad. I bought this Panasonic after I read its review on PhotographyBlog.com that gives this camera a rating of 4, a fairly high score for a $120 camera.

Reviews.Title: Lens is easily contaminated
Reviews.Author: S. Stewart
Reviews.Content: Pictures had a smudge in every picture. Apparently when the lens extends at power-on, the vacuum caused then can draw dust into the lens and charge-coupled-device (CCD.)With help from an internet video; I was able to repair the camera. I have experience repairing miniature electronics, but I do not recommended this procedure for a novice as do-it-yourself. I Believe the camera has a design flaw. I say -- don't buy.

Reviews.Title: User Manual
Reviews.Author: Melvin D. Price
Reviews.Content: I am disappointed that the User Manual is written in Spanish. I can not read Spanish  therefore I am having to guess how to use the camera.What must I do in order to get a User Manual written in English?

Reviews.Title: Its a camera!
Reviews.Author: Seva
Reviews.Content: You can take pictures with it! How incredibly cool is that? Only has 70meg internal space so you need to buy an SD card with it if you plan on taking video or lots of photos, but who cares, sd cards are cheap as fug and pop right in the camera.

Reviews.Title: Fast
Reviews.Author: Karla
Reviews.Content: the camera is fast. pretty simple set up. but you dont have the option to edit or crop your pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Rosalie Mehrab "hamburgerologist"
Reviews.Content: I first ordered the "blue" model of this camera and when it arrived it was purple...the box said blue but it was purple. I exchanged the camera for a black one and I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: I thought it was supposed to be easy.
Reviews.Author: ozarkgal30
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera because it was supposed to be easy to use.  I had a stoke 2 years ago and is difficult to dosome things now. I odered it a few months ago and I still have not gotten it working.  I put battery in earlier todayand got the disk loaded and camera on for a total of 30 minites and battery dead again. I have trouble getting batteryout and charged. If you are looking for a came.a that is easy to use...you may look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: Great features, not very sturdy
Reviews.Author: elle fan
Reviews.Content: We bought this for Christmas for our 8-year-old daughter who loves to take pictures.  She was thrilled, and it was a very easy-to-use camera with easy-to-use features, and a great value.  She figured out how to do a slide show all by herself.  Then my 5-year-old son stepped on it once, on the carpet no less, and now the top corner of the screen (about a one-inch area) is messed up.  It is still usable, but we are saddened that she has to put up with that, at least until we get her another one.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-S3 Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Sandve "Master Ortho."
Reviews.Content: So far the camera proforms pretty well. I have had it for a month or so with little or no problems. The viewer at times seems grainey and blurey, the pictures come out fine though? Not sure yet on overall satisfaction?

Reviews.Title: VERY DISAPPOINTED
Reviews.Author: thecat'smeow
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera and when I received it I could not use it because ALL of the instructions in it were in a foreign language~ there was NO section in English.  This is the same as not getting an instruction booklet at all!  In addition, the warranty, oddly, which was in English, did not cover the camera if purchased in the United States, which is where I happen to live.  Why this camera would be sent to a U.S. buyer and user is totally beyond me.  With an instruction book in a foreign language, it is useless to me, so I have returned it and I am extremely disappointed about the whole thing.

Reviews.Title: broke when dropped two feet
Reviews.Author: Michelle D. Stadel
Reviews.Content: I had only taken four pictures with this camera when I dropped it. It landed on it's side on concrete and gave an error message when I turned it on. I have a Sony that is six years old that has been dropped dozens of times and still works fine. I can't rate any of the features as I barely had time to play with it. I did take a couple of pictures of moving fish at Monterey Aquarium that turned out nicely. The camera is very slippery and in my husband's opinion, way too small. I think a camera should be able to survive a two foot drop, even onto concrete.

ProductInfo.Features:
14.1-megapixel resolution; 4x optical image-stablized zoom
720p HD video capture at 30fps
Panasonic iA mode makes it simple for anyone to take beautiful photos
LUMIX Image Uploader makes it simple to share pictures on Facebook and video on YouTube
Capture images and video to  SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Panasonic Lumix DMC-S3 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 2.7-Inch LCD (Purple)
